security: This document discusses the ARRB's (Assassination Records Review Board) objective to assure the public that all JFK assassination-related files have been located. It also mentions specific offices and files within the CIA that the ARRB wants to search, including DCI files, Richard Helms' files, and DO offices. Providing details on which files the ARRB is interested in could compromise internal CIA processes and reveal search methodologies. For example: "Gunn asked if he can go to WTC and/or other Records Centers and look at shelf lists and the files around a topic of special interest?"
summary: A memo summarizing a meeting between the CIA and the ARRB regarding the ARRB's compliance review of JFK assassination records, focusing on search completeness and access to CIA files.
summary_one_paragraph: This memo summarizes a meeting held on January 7, 1997, between CIA representatives Barry Harrelson and Eileen Wukitch and ARRB staff, including Jeremy Gunn, to discuss the CIA's response to the ARRB's compliance letter concerning JFK assassination records. The ARRB aims to assure the public that all relevant files have been located and that no secret files remain, dividing records into sequestered files, special requests, and previously unidentified records. The ARRB staff seeks to ensure that relevant agency components and files have been searched, expressing interest in DCI files, Richard Helms' files, OGC, DDP, DO offices, DI, TSD files, DA, OS, DS&T, specific stations, and Commo records, raising questions about record centers, shelf lists, name traces, and routing indicators.
title: "Compliance" Meeting with ARRB Staff
sender: Barry Harrelson, CSI/HRG and Eileen Wukitch, DO/IMS/JFK team
